title: Revelation: Babylon Falls
objective: Understand God's final judgments and the collapse of rebellious world systems.

required_passages.text: The bowls of wrath were poured out... Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great... Hallelujah! For the Lord our God the Almighty reigns... the Rider on the white horse judges and makes war in righteousness.

segments.audio_script: Judgment reaches its climax as Babylon falls and heaven rejoices in God's justice.

Listen to Revelation 15-19. Seven bowl judgments complete God's wrath against persistent rebellion. Babylon, symbol of idolatrous and oppressive civilization, is exposed and destroyed. Heaven answers with hallelujah praise for God's righteous judgments. The vision culminates in the return of Christ as faithful warrior-king defeating evil powers.
Babylon imagery would resonate with believers facing imperial pressure and seductive wealth systems.
God's justice is not arbitrary; it answers entrenched evil and vindicates saints. Believers are called to come out of Babylon's compromises and remain pure for Christ.
Key themes include divine justice, judgment completion, Babylon's seduction and fall, heavenly worship, and Christ's triumphant return.
Reflect on this: What habits or loyalties in your life still mirror Babylon's values more than Christ's kingdom?
Babylon falls, and Christ reigns in righteousness. Next, Revelation shows final defeat of evil and the great white throne.
